results.name: Break up the list of values of the divisor function d(k) into nondecreasing runs; sequence gives lengths of successive runs.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: The initial values of d(k) = A000005(k) for k = 1,2,3,... are
Breaking this up into nondecreasing runs we get:
xref: A303578(m) gives value of n that starts the m-th run.
A284597(m) is the smallest number that starts a run of length m.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 29 2018
